subject: FROM THE DESK OF DR DESMOND
body:
FROM THE DESK OF DR DESMOND WILLIAMS
(ABC)ABIDJAN, COTE D'IVOIRE.       
Email:  
williamdesmond967@gmail.com
Telephone: 
Sir,
My name is DR, DESMOND WILLIAMS and I am the Director General of the Allocation Board Committee (ABC) in Abidjan Cote dâ€™Ivoire. 
I have been instructed by my colleagues to seek for a reliable and trustworthy firm or individual from your country who could assist us to transfer the total sum of USD$85 Million, Into his account. 
The Government has approved the payment of this fund only waiting for the beneficiary to come for the claim.
I wait your kindly reply to me on this email.    
 Best regards
DR, DESMOND WILLIAMS.
Chairman Allocation Board Committee

subject: Re:   FROM THE DESK OF DR DESMOND
body:
Hello Dr. Desmond Williams,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite intrigued by your message and the opportunity it presents. However, I would like to understand more about this situation.

Could you please provide more details about the Allocation Board Committee? What is its purpose and role in Abidjan Cote Ivoire? Also, could you explain why this fund needs to be transferred and why my assistance is required?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Gerardo

subject: MEMO OF THE CONTRACT USD$85M
body:
Dear Gerardo

*RE- MEMO FOR OVER INVOICING MEMO OF THE CONTRACT USD$85M*

Be informed, the original contract is paid, this is the left over invoice
that has a special vault to claim.

The issue is the vault, need a claimant, who will procure the documents
such as Third-Party Indemnity Bond/ Re-validation Order, in the name of
this Beneficiary, to enable the Swiss paying bank, create special online
banking for such Beneficiary to proceed into the personal vault of the
deposit to start the tranche transfer gradually to his account until the
vault will be empty, for the claim of over invoice to clear by the
Authority.

Please, advice on the subject matter.
Regards,
Desmond Williams

subject: Re: MEMO OF THE CONTRACT USD$85M
body:
Hello Desmond Williams,

Thank you for your message. It's quite interesting to hear about this left over invoice and the special vault. I must admit, it's a bit complex for me to fully understand.

Could you please explain a bit more about this Indemnity Bond Order? What exactly is its purpose in this process? And how does the Swiss paying bank come into play?

Also, could you clarify what you mean by "tranche transfer"? Is that a specific type of financial transaction?

I'm looking forward to hearing more about this.

Best wishes,
Gerardo

subject: LATEST DEVELOPMENT
body:
Dear Gerardo,

Sir,

It is quite clear your questions on the over invoicing transaction of
usd$85M receipt.

1. Third-Party Indemnity Bond, is the legal frame work connecting the proxy
claimant, of the over-invoice, and the original contract awarded person.

Who does that, is the judiciary,  that created the legal framework. Take
note of this angle called Third Party Indemnity Bond, which gives you
permission to claim the over invoice legally, channel it in investment
without review by any authority, as soon as Judiciary re-issued the
documents in your name. After it must have been re-legalized, from original
contract awarded person, t your good self.

The Banque Suisse,  was the first, who paid the original contractor the
first value, this over invoice value, does not concern him, it is only the
Swiss Bank who handles the vault and has power to pay it, after judiciary
must have, re-legalized the Third-Party Indemnity Bond on your behalf.

2. Tranche transfer means, the special online banking, which Banque Suisse
creates for you to handle personally per limits, as the server permits per
day until the vault of the usd$85M is cleared.  That is what I mean by per
tranche transfer from you, to the bank server daily. So, there will be no
eye brows raised on the remittance to you. Online banking has been the
preferred mode of payment, registered for the claim of the usd$85M, that is
all.

In a strong terms, you can reach the legal advocate:

Name: Sam Smith
Email:  legal.dept@notarybills.org


He is the legal consultant to the reviewed documents of the over invoice
contract.  Also, reach the bank (Banque Suisse):

Director: Mr S.Nelson
Email: banquesuissedepositdept@headoffice-dpt.co

Seek the payment plan from the two institutes , for prompt facilitation of
the transaction of the over invoice.  Remember to attach your ID, phone
number and address for the facilitation to start. I have made your payment
request officially.
Best regards,
Desmond William

subject: Re: LATEST DEVELOPMENT
body:
Hello Gerardo,

I hope this message finds you well. I appreciate your detailed explanation about the Indemnity Bond and its role in the over-invoicing process. It's fascinating to learn about these legal frameworks and how they connect different parties.

You mentioned a Third Party Indemity Bond, which allows me to claim the over invoice legally. Could you please elaborate more on this? How does it work exactly?

Also, I'm intrigued by the concept of Tranche transfer that you explained. It seems like a secure way to handle large amounts of money. However, could you clarify what you mean by "per limits, as the server permits per day"? Is there a specific limit on how much can be transferred daily?

You suggested reaching out to a legal advocate and Banque Suisse for further information. Could you provide more details about who I should contact specifically? 

Lastly, while I understand your request for my ID, phone number and address, I must apologize as I am not comfortable sharing such personal information online due to privacy concerns.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Gerardo
